dialogs.responseText: Welcome to the Wind Hall. It is one of the few locations in the world that allows for the practice of Alchemy. Alchemy is a secret art, you will likely need a teacher to assist you in learning the proper steps.

dialogs.buttonText: Where can I find a teacher?
dialogs.responseText: The alchemists of Tsu City are known all around Quepland. Perhaps you have heard of them? It would be a good place to start.
Ha! Though I have studied on my own for many years, I fear I am no closer to understanding the secrets of alchemy than I was when I started.

dialogs.buttonText: Well why don't you get a teacher?
dialogs.responseText: I had a teacher, once, when I lived in Tsu City. I suppose I should warn you that not all those in the Alchemy Guild are open to sharing their secrets with outsiders. If you are not careful you may end up like me, teacherless; or worse, like my teacher, dead.

dialogs.buttonText: Why learn alchemy if its so difficult and dangerous?
dialogs.responseText: There is some value of the pursuit of knowledge for its own sake. The chance to turn copper into gold is also a good incentive.

dialogs.buttonText: I can turn copper into gold?
dialogs.responseText: If you learn the recipe, yes. Though converting metals into weaker, more common metals is far easier. I'm afraid I've already told you more than I should have. Please do not mention me if you do choose to visit the Alchemy Guild.
